image.altText: Jess Fox pretends to take a bite from her gold medal.

props.synopsis: Australia wins a fourth gold medal at the Paris Olympics, as Jess Fox takes victory in the women's canoe slalom K1 on the white water on day two.

title.children: Jess Fox wins gold in dramatic canoe slalom K1 final as Australia adds to medal tally

image.altText: Albanese purses his lips as he speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has made larger-than-expected changes to his frontbench. But a new study shows exactly the depth of trouble his government is in.

title.children: Albanese's woes go much deeper than a reshuffle. Voter confidence has plummeted

image.altText: People collect their bags at the carousel at the Brisbane airport.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's decision to parachute Tony Burke into the troubled home affairs portfolio may be about fixing some of the government's immigration woes, but it leaves unanswered questions over student and skilled visas, says a top migration expert.

title.children: Top visa expert says Clare O'Neil's departure leaves controversial student visa policy in state of uncertainty

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: In the extraordinary moment when Donald Trump was left bloodied by a would-be assassin's bullet, the political reality changed. Then, it was the Democrats' turn for a dramatic twist.

title.children: Trump seemed indestructible, but a remarkable new dynamic has emerged in the race for the White House

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing to the public for information after a young boy was hit by a taxi at Plympton Park on Sunday morning.

title.children: Boy, 4, hit and seriously injured by taxi while riding bike in suburban Adelaide street

image.altText: A women's soccer team wearing yellow celebrates scoring a goal

props.synopsis: Trailing Zambia 4-2 at half-time of a chaotic second game, the Matildas completed a stunning comeback to win 6-5 and keep their Olympics hopes alive.

title.children: Matildas defeat Zambia 6-5 in stunning comeback at Paris Olympics

image.altText: A man and a woman stand on their front step, looking into camera with serious facial expressions.

props.synopsis: The $12 billion land lease industry, which caters to retirees looking for affordable low-maintenance living, has largely flown under the radar. But across the country, more claims are emerging of questionable practices including fee gouging, excessive rent increases and misleading contracts.

title.children: Financial horror stories are emerging from these gated villages across Australia

image.altText: A composite of Gretchen Whitmer (left), Mark Kelly (top), Josh Shapiro (right), and Pete Buttigieg (bottom)

props.synopsis: In the space of a week, the US vice-president has wooed heavy-hitting Democrats to back her election campaign. Now, she's looking for her own number two, and there are plenty of people with claims to the ticket.

title.children: White men are the easy choices to run with Kamala Harris, but there could yet be a surprise

image.altText: A crowd of men carries a coffin and a portrait of a girl

props.synopsis: As Israel convenes its security cabinet following a rocket strike in Golan Heights, US Vice-President Kamala Harris says her support for Israel's security remains "ironclad".

title.children: US blames Hezbollah for Golan Heights strike

image.altText: A young man standing in an airport holding his luggage

props.synopsis: With his bag checked in and passport in hand, Michael Pascale boarded an international flight in May 2020, oblivious to the real journey he was embarking on.

title.children: 'I refused to let them win': After this traveller's luggage went missing, he took on the airline — and won

image.altText: old hotel on fire

props.synopsis: A 37-year-old man will face court on Monday charged with arson, after a fire ripped through a building complex containing North Adelaide's historic Oxford Hotel.

title.children: Man charged with arson over blaze that caused up to $3 million of damage to historic Adelaide hotel site

image.altText: Jess Fox smiles while walking through the crowd with an Australian flag draped over her shoulders

props.synopsis: Jess Fox was already an Olympic gold medallist, and already an Australian sporting champion. But this Paris triumph, celebrated with friends and family and a roaring crowd of Australians, is on a whole other level to anything that came before.

title.children: Jess Fox finally gets the gold medal moment she deserved, surrounded by green, gold and love

image.altText: Leon Marchant holds up his hands

props.synopsis: France expected a champion to rise on night two of the swimming at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. And Léon Marchand was raised higher than he could have dreamed by a staggeringly passionate crowd.

title.children: 'That was special': Waves of irrepressible joy as France roars home its new champion

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: The Aussies have walked away with one gold on day two of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Check out the full medal tally.

title.children: Here's the medal standings for Day Two of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus waving to supporters in the swimming pool after winning a race

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan's 200m freestyle final will be a highlight for the Monday night into Tuesday morning schedule — here's all the action for Day Three.

title.children: Full day three schedule as Titmus and O'Callaghan showdown headlines a busy day for Australia

image.altText: A woman named Kylena Hill looks upset as she looks at a stack of papers on a table.

props.synopsis: Kylena Hill says she and her five children are soon to be homeless, while her violent ex-partner is out on bail for multiple, brutal attacks on her.

title.children: A Perth woman's family is facing eviction. Her neighbours say they're a nuisance, but she has nowhere to turn

image.altText: Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train graphic black and white with aerial view of their property behind

props.synopsis: The radicalisation of Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train is expected to form part of an inquest that begins today into the shootings at Wieambilla in 2022.

title.children: Inquest begins into 'religiously motivated' attack that killed two Queensland police officers

image.altText: A sign says 'my daughter should be as safe as my son, no more violence'

props.synopsis: It has been six months since Ballarat mother of three Samantha Murphy disappeared, followed by the deaths of Rebecca Young and Hannah McGuire. On Saturday, the community showed its determination to stamp out gendered violence.

title.children: Six months since Samantha Murphy disappeared, feelings of anger and fear remain

image.altText: A man sits with two people in Beswick

props.synopsis: Territorians are heading to the polls in a matter of weeks to cast their vote in the 2024 NT Election, but there's a massive area — nearly 20 times the size of Tasmania — that isn't willing to vote.

title.children: The NT election is fast approaching, but in 'forgotten' seats thousands won't be voting

image.altText: George Russell sitting by some signage after an F1 race.

props.synopsis: The Mercedes driver's car was found to be under the minimum weight limit post-race.

title.children: George Russell disqualified and stripped of F1 win

image.altText: A closeup of one of the secret files about the Kenyan detention camps released by the British government.

props.synopsis: For decades the British government hid secret files about the detention and torture of Kenyan resistance fighters. This is how they were revealed and the horrors they contained.

title.children: How the British were forced to reveal secret files on torture of Kenyan resistance fighters

image.altText: Jane sitting on dock in blue dress, beach in background.

props.synopsis: SCAD causes heart attacks in healthy women under 50, and the high recurrence rate leaves many survivors living in fear.

title.children: 'They live in fear': The mental health impact of living with a mysterious heart condition

image.altText: A baby boy sitting upright in a hospital bed for children with tubes fed through his nose.

props.synopsis: Families with children who have received life-saving organ transplants gathered for the launch of DonateLife Week, urging more Australians to register as donors.

title.children: Harlen received a liver transplant that saved his life — but many more like him are still on the waitlist

image.altText: A white brunette woman with blue eyes smizes as she poses at a premiere for photographers.

props.synopsis: An instinctual actor who follows her gut, the Borgen star and Westworld villain says that sound can often lead the way.

title.children: Borgen star Sidse Babbett Knudsen is a morally compromised prison guard trying to make a difference in Sons

image.altText: A boy writes with a pencil in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Dealing with poor behaviour and reporting incidents is the most common workload burden affecting teachers' ability to help their students learn, according to a new survey of Queensland state schools.

title.children: Managing student behaviour is piling pressure on teachers, survey finds

image.altText: Two women with short gray hair laughing together in an art gallery.

props.synopsis: How do you make sense of natural disasters and trauma? This remote community uses art and creative expression as a form of therapy to support their healing and recovery.

title.children: Art brings colour and healing to town left ashen grey amid bushfire trauma

image.altText: Shireen Romi wears a blue top in front of an orange backdrop

props.synopsis: Three teenagers who fled some of the worst atrocities of the 21st century find refuge and catharsis in sharing their stories on stage.

title.children: Three refugee teenagers escaped unspeakable horrors, but are using theatre to move forward

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: International student Devarshi Deka, who was left paraplegic after an alleged attack in Hobart, has had his dream of staying in Australia realised.

title.children: Student Devarshi Deka granted permanent residency in final acts by outgoing immigration minister

image.altText: Koren Helbig sits at her dining table with a raised laptop, keyboard and mouse, working from home.

props.synopsis: Working long hours had left me feeling exhausted and burnt out. Making an effort to be thrifty has allowed me to work part-time.

title.children: The lifestyle changes I made to make part-time work possible

image.altText: Isaac Heeney shows his frustration

props.synopsis: Major questions have been raised surrounding Sydney's premiership credentials after the Swans were manhandled by the Western Bulldogs at the SCG on Sunday.

title.children: 'A long way off': Major questions raised over Sydney's premiership credentials after SCG meltdown against Bulldogs

image.altText: Bangladesh protesters on the street.

props.synopsis: A Bangladeshi student group vows to resume protests that sparked a lethal police crackdown and nationwide unrest unless several of its leaders are released from custody.

title.children: Protesters vow to resume demonstrations in Bangladesh unless leaders are freed

image.altText: A mudslide tears through a green forest of trees before destroying a house at the base of a hill

props.synopsis: The people were killed in a mudslide in a tourist region of China that had been battered by significant rainfall linked to the typhoon, which had been downgraded to a tropical storm after passing through Taiwan.

title.children: Fifteen killed in China as fallout from Typhoon Gaemi continues

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: The prime minister has unveiled his new-look frontbench as he seeks to refresh his cabinet ahead of the next federal election.

title.children: Anthony Albanese moves Clare O'Neil, Andrew Giles in cabinet reshuflle

image.altText: A graphic shows several ministers and a deck of cards being sorted.

props.synopsis: Promotions, demotions and retirements — find out who is entering cabinet or picking up a ministry out of the Albanese government's reshuffle.

title.children: Who's in and who's out after Anthony Albanese's ministry reshuffle?

image.altText: A woman looking up and smiling.

props.synopsis: Senator McCarthy has been announced as the new minister for Indigenous Australians. Her rise to one of Australia's most challenging and prestigious positions didn't come without hardship and hurdles on the way.

title.children: From TV journo to one of Australia’s most important roles: The rise of Malarndirri McCarthy
